CONJUGATES: varies (3rd p. sing. present) | varied (past tense/past participle) | varying (present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English varien, from Old French varier, from Latin variāre 'to change, alter', ultimately from varius 'various, changing'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To differ in size, amount, degree, or nature from something else in the same general category; to be subject to change.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不同，变化，有差异 (指同一类别的事物在大小、数量、程度或性质上有所不同)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The interest rates on mortgages can vary widely depending on the lender.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 抵押贷款的利率会因贷款机构的不同而差异很大。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To introduce changes to something; to modify or diversify something previously uniform.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 改变，更改，使多样化 (使原本一致或单调的事物有所变化)。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The teacher decided to vary her teaching methods to keep the students engaged.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 老师决定改变她的教学方法，以保持学生的参与度。
